intro: Eria jagoriana, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and green foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
